caption: The Louvre semi private tour we had last week with Emily was fantastic.  All was seamless and she communicated very well so there were no questions around logistics on the day of the tour. Emily was present exactly when she said she would be and had earpieces for everyone so we could hear her speaking throughout the tour.  We went on the tour with 2 other couples for a total of six and although we have been to the Louvre 2 other times, Emily's knowledge and passion for art made it all that much better.  We saw the most popular works that many would expect in addition to many others that we saw but didn't know the history. Emily pointed out a number of things that we had never even knew. Emily is very well spoken and being an artist herself makes all that she shared more impactful. I would highly recommend this tour and Emily.
We had an amazing time at the Louvre with Babylon Tours and our guide Eduardo was fantastic! Hope to be able to try another one of their tours soon.

This is our second trip to Paris. We didn't do it Louvre last year because it's SERIOUSLY overwhelming. It's massive and we don't know what we're doing. We decided we couldn't come to Paris a second time without doing the Louvre, so we decided to get help and booked a guided tour. My expectations were still low and assumed the kids would be miserable, but we could cross it off the bucket list. I was wrong.  Our tour guide, Paloma, has a PhD in Medieval Art History and clearly has some experience with keeping kids engaged because both of my kids (10 and 16) were with her the ENTIRE 3.5 hours.  There's no way we'd have gotten the same level of context out of a random visit to the Louvre, reading the little descriptions ourselves. I'm SO glad we did this.  This morning, my son was reflecting on our trip so far and says the Louvre tour was his favorite thing that we've done.

An amazing tour of the Louvre and an amazing tour guide.  We got to see everything most important at the Louvre.  Our tour guide was super knowledgeable and made sure we saw everything we wanted to.  She answered lots of questions.  Was very personable and spoke perfect English.

Our guided tour of the Louvre Museum in Paris was excellent. Our small-group tour guide was personable and extremely knowledgeable. She did a wonderful job of making our visit to the Louvre a great one!

Marcel was our tour guide for the Louvre last Sunday.  He brought the art to life with his words and knowledge of art history! My husband and I had never visited France before but we would go back in a heartbeat, just so we could have Marcel be our guide again.  He was an amazing host! I highly recommend him! He was very professional and used headphones for us so he didn‚Äôt have to shout above all the crowds.  Marcel, you are the best! Thank you for making our first trip to Paris so enjoyable!

Liliya was the BEST tour guide. The Louvre is overwhelming and attempting to see on our own would have been challenging at best. Instead, we had a delightful tour and super group chemistry. Her background makes her exceptionally qualified. Thank you!!

We booked the semi-private Louvre tour. We only had 6 people total, it was very cozy and efficient. Our tour guide, Malaika was very personable and enjoyable. She went over the history of the building and then did a wonderful job weaving in all the most popular pieces. You won't be disappointed!

We had a fabulous tour of the Louvre today led by Hugo. He was extremely knowledgeable about the art, architecture and history but importantly, he was engaging and entertaining. Having been on many guided tours over the past few weeks this was the most fun and most interesting!

Our private Babylon Tour of the Mus√©e d'Orsay was outstanding, thanks to our incredible guide, Sunday! Before the tour, she sent a text confirming all logistics so there was no stress about meeting up. Upon arrival, Sunday‚Äôs guide status allowed us to skip the long lines and go right in. She also had special listening devices so our group could always clearly hear what she was saying, even when it was crowded/loud in certain galleries. Her enthusiasm and extensive knowledge about the Impressionist movement and Rodin's sculptures added a profound dimension to the tour. The iconic artworks, from Manet, Monet, Degas, Renoir, Van Gough, C√©zanne and others, were brought to life as Sunday provided details into their techniques and stories behind each masterpiece. üñºÔ∏è Our entire group, including three jet-lagged 20-year-olds, was captivated by the storytelling and the connections drawn between different artists and movements. If you're looking for a thoroughly enjoyable experience at the Mus√©e d'Orsay, this tour is great and Sunday is the guide you want!
We had a wonderful experience with Babylon Tours of the Louvre in Paris. Our guides, Marcelle and Nadia, were so friendly, organized and knowledgeable. I would book again with them in an instant!

My wife and I were in Paris for our honeymoon and we did a semi private tour of the Lourve with Mathieu and it was awesome! Mathieu was not only friendly and courteous, but so knowledgable and genuinely enjoyed teaching us so much about the museum and the art throughout the tour. He knew so much and we had a great time.

Babylon Semi Private Tour at the Louvre Museum in Paris was really good with Julien who was the tour guide who showed knowledge and history of the venue and the art. I recommend to book in the morning when there are less people and lines.

We had an amazing tour of the Musee D‚ÄôOrsay with Mathieu. His friendly and engaging style and his extensive knowledge of the various pieces and art movements greatly enhanced our experience of the museum. We would highly recommend this tour. Thanks so much Mathieu!

Babylon Tours offers a seamless and enjoyable experience, making it easy for travelers to explore iconic destinations like the Louvre. Our guide, Marcel, impresses with his extensive knowledge of art and Louvre history, enriching the tour with fascinating insights. Marcel's expertise and engaging presentation make the experience both informative and captivating. The tour is well-organized, ensuring a smooth and enjoyable journey through the museum's treasures. With Babylon Tours, visitors can expect a memorable and enriching exploration of cultural landmarks, guided by passionate experts like Marcel.

Our knowledgeable tour guide, Margeaux, made this tour of the Louvre an absolute success!!  We learned many details and thoroughly enjoyed the entire tour of 2 hours. I would highly recommend you ask for Margeaux, a painter, and student of the arts.  She gave us so many details and this turned out to be the highlight of our day and time in Paris!!

It was a little confusing finding the tour meeting place for the louvre but, now get ready, Marcele our tour guide actually called us to direct us to meeting point which we were 2 minutes.  I have read terrible reviews of tour guides just leaving.  Marcele was very knowledgeable about everything at the Louvre and it was not drawn put or boring.  Answered all questions.  Luis and I are very happy with this tour and Marcele.

Our guide on our tour of the Louvre was excellent!  Encyclopedic knowledge of the museum and the exhibits.  He spent just the right amount of time showing us the major exhibits (and explaining their history) for the time we had allotted.  Highly recommended!

We had an outstanding tour of The Louvre. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and knew the museum layout very well to be able to get us around the crowds. Well worth the money, we will use Babylon Tours again!

emailed guide a week before to ask how we can find him we were told youll be emailed the day before. The day before we were given minimal information just told to stand in front of Louis statue on the horse. Got there early 7:30 am to take photos and have coffee. Came back at 9 am meeting time was 10am. At 9:45 am started calling out for Babylon Tours as at this point there were hundreds of tourists in front of the statue. We found two other guides from Babylon tours but not our guide. He was standing in the far left with hundreds of people around he did not hold a flag or anything to let people know he was there. We proceeded to the bag scans with missing tourists. He then decided to go back and find people after we had passed through bag scans. People were missing and we had to wait he ruined our day. The organisation in terms of finding him was a nightmare

Semi-private Louvre tour was amazing with our guide, Hugo.  Hugo has his masters in art history with a speciality in French romanticism. He‚Äôs incredibly knowledgeable about the Louvre, highly engaging, fun, and spunky.  Highly recommend booking this tour and seeing if you can join Hugo‚Äôs crew. Have fun!

So glad we used a guide from Babylon Tours to show our three teenagers the highlights at the Louvre Museum. She was engaging yet not overbearing, very personable, professional and knowledgeable. I cannot stress enough how much better your Louvre experience is with a tour guide - especially with teenagers. We told our guide we wanted the highlights and that's exactly what she gave us. And when we were in the La Galerie M√©dicis she used an analogy to a popular Netflix show that our kids are familiar with. It was a very creative way to explain this artistic cycle and make it relevant. Merci, Babylon Tours.

I booked Babylon Tours of the Louvre after much research and I was not disappointed. There was a transport strike on the day of the tour but our guide Laura was on time and the tour was both enjoyable and informative. Can highly recommend Babylon Tours.

We booked a semi-private tour of the Louvre with Sunday as our guide. She was an absolute gem who really knew how to explain things/give the history on the different pieces of art in a way that drew us in. The Louvre is huge and it would be impossible to see all of it in one day, but the tour covered several main pieces in detail. I highly recommend booking this tour especially with Sunday as your guide! You won't regret it!

Most amazing tours of Paris! We did the louvre/orsay package and we were so impressed with that tour and our guide we also we did the city walking tour. Absolutely use Babylon!!! Had the best time with our guide, Dario, who was so knowledgeable and friendly. We ended up going on their rjikes museum tour in Amsterdam when we went there. Customer service is the best you‚Äôll get in Paris, hands-down, we couldn‚Äôt find the tour (our fault), and they helped us find the guide easily and quickly, and they were so understanding.

Skip the Linevtour of the Louvre. The Babylon guide, Romain V., was an excellent. Romain was like having an art history class. Informative, engaging, and well worth the time and money. The tour was one of the highlights of my trip.

Best tour ever. Lili our guide was informative, passionate and funny. She had fascinating insights and anecdotes for each of the major works we visited. It was our first Louvre visit and she covered all the ‚Äúmust-sees‚Äù as well as some less obvious but fascinating ones - everything from antiquities to of course the Mona Lisa. Booking through Babylon was easy and hassle free. We‚Äôll definitely be touring with them again. .

We did a Latin Quarter walking tour with Francois. He was incredibly enthusiastic, passionate, entertaining and informative with lots of interesting facts and stories. We learnt so much. There were only four of us. The meeting point was easy to find and Babylon Tours excellent with communication. Highly recommend walking tours with Francois, a great way to explore and experience Paris. He gave us some great tips and advice for Paris too.

We took the Semi Private Tour of the Louvre with Anais. She did an excellent job of explaining key pieces in the collection in a way that was interesting to me and my young children. We skipped all the lines and she expertly guided us through the crowds. 100% recommend!

Today my wife and I were part of a small group walking tour of the Louvre. Our guide Michele‚Äôs detailed knowledge of the Louvre and French art history enhanced our enjoyment of the tour. Our visit will long be remembered fondly.

What an amazing experience!  Valerie was absolutely awesome!  I have never enjoyed museums... until now!  She was so enthusiastic and knowledgeable, she absolutely made this tour a wonderful journey through history with art!  I can't say enough great things about Valerie... tour with her and you will be wowed!  Thank you Valerie, for changing my mind about art!

I intend on leaving separate reviews, but I don‚Äôt think I can on Google for my two tour guides. First, my wife and I did the private louvre tour for 2.5 hours with Nancy.  Absolutely brilliant.  She was very well mannered, extremely pleasant and polite, and very knowledgeable.  She made sure my wife and I had the louvre experience we wanted and it was everything and more!  If I could give more than 5 stars I would!!!  And then we had Francois for our pere lachaise cemetery!  Also absolutely brilliant, very pleasant and polite and extremely funny and entertaining.  He also made sure we learned the history, fun stories, and a lot of great tips and background to some of the most brilliant persons In history buried in pere lachaise.  Honestly we are definitely booking with Babylon tours‚Ä¶ the only problem now is who do we request?  Nancy or Francois.  Both equally brilliant.  And if you read my reviews, I do not shy from leaving negative or positive feedback where it‚Äôs due.  Babylon tours, Nancy and Francois are amazing.  Please make sure each receive positive feedback and something special.  They are incredibly unique and bring more than just a monotony of history and facts, but an expressive form of learning and engaging to their audience.  Highly recommend and will do this again!
Our tour guide for the Louvre was great! She was knowledgeable and we were very happy  we decided to book a tour!

We had a fantastic tour of Orsay Museum with Alex from BabylonTours!! Alex went over and above on the tour and explained the evolution of the impressionist movement in a clear, easy to understand, non-rushed manner. Babylon Tours are a well-organised tour group that covers all bases and make the whole experience a breeze, from booking, through to the completion of the tour. I would highly recommend Babylon Tours.

My semi-private tour consisted of a family of four and myself. Could not have been better.  The guide (forgot his name) was very knowledgeable about the pieces we saw and impressed me with his in-depth information he shared with us.  Answered all questions in depth.  Totally awesome experience.

Toured the Louvre with Daniel on Monday, Nov 29, 2021.  It was the best personal tour ever.  Daniel was an excellent guide and made the experience ever so much more enjoyable.  I felt like I had a taste of each section of the museum and hit the high spots.  I can remember the things we saw and the story behind them instead of leaving with it all one big blur.  Great job, Daniel!

My friend and I did the semi private tour of Louvre with Alex. He was really charming and engaging, bringing us through the history of the museum and the masterpieces. This was the highlight of our trip!

My family visited Paris earlier this month and had purchased a tour of the Louvre through a travel agency before leaving.  We were met by a pretty English girl on the appointed day & time.  Harriet gave us each maps and explained the history of the building itself.  She was extremely knowledgeable, kind and patient.  It was a very busy day and she knew how to navigate through the crowds so we could hear her and not be hindered by other groups.  She explained the significance of a lot of the rooms, not just the exhibits themselves, and took us to the most famous exhibits so we didn't have to waste time wandering around. The tour was definitely worth the money and I would highly recommend Harriet at Babylon Tours.
